REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, user_id: int, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new concact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the concact to create.

  • user_id (int) – The user ID to create the note for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

src.repository.contacts.date_replace_year(d: date, year: int) → date¶

Function for replacing the year in the date, if the date is not in the year to be replaced, then we get the next day for this date in this year.

Parameters:

  • d (date) – Source date

  • year (int) – Year to replace in date

Returns:

Date with the year replaced

Return type:

date

async src.repository.contacts.delete(contact_id: int, user_id: int, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user_id (int) – The user ID to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.favorite_update(contact_id: int, body: ContactFavoriteModel, user_id: int, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates favorute status (i.e. “true” or “false”) of contact with the specified ID for a specific user ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactFavoriteModel) – The updated data with favorite status for the contact.

  • user_id (int) – The user ID to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email: str, user_id: int, db: Session) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified email for a specific ID of user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the contact to retrieve.

  • user_id (int) – The user ID to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Specified contact for specific user.

Return type:

Contact

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific ID of user.

  • user_id (int) – The user ID to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session, user_id: int, skip: int, limit: int, favorite: bool | None = None) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user_id (int) – The user_id to retrieve contacts for.

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • favorite (bool | None, optional) – The favorite flag of contact, defaults to None.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.search_birthday(param: dict, user_id: int, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with the specified birthday search parameters for the next few days and pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • param (dict{'days': int, 'skip': int, 'limit': int}) –

    This is dictionary of parameters for search contacts. Dictionary keys:

    • days - Search for contacts whose birthdays are within the next number of days from the current date, defaults to 7

    • skip - The number of contacts to skip

    • limit - The maximum number of contacts to return

  • user_id (int) – The user ID to search the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(param: dict, user_id: int, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified search and pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • param (dict{"first_name": str, "last_name": str, "email": str, "skip": int, "limit": int}) –

    This is dictionary of parameters for search contacts. Dictionary keys:

    • first_name - (optional) First name of contact

    • last_name - (optional) Last name of contact

    • email - (optional) email of contact

    • skip - The number of contacts to skip

    • limit - The maximum number of contacts to return

  • user_id (int) – The user ID to search the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user_id: int, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user_id (int) – The user ID to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

class src.services.emails.EmailSchema(*, email: EmailStr, fullname: str = 'Sender Name', subject: str = 'Sender Subject topic')¶

Bases: BaseModel

Class EmailSchema

Parameters:

BaseModel (_type_) – _description_

email: EmailStr¶
fullname: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {'email': FieldInfo(annotation=EmailStr, required=True), 'fullname': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=False, default='Sender Name'), 'subject': FieldInfo(annotation=str, required=False, default='Sender Subject topic')}¶

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo].

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.
